intro: Alyxia insularis, commonly known as the island alyxia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, with five petals and a prominent corona. Alyxia insularis is adapted to coastal and disturbed habitats, often found in sandy or rocky soils.
